A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: As someone who eagerly awaited and saw the first Star Wars in May 1977 (yeah it dates me)\, I was somewhat disappointed on learning that the saga will not end with Episode IX. The epic\, even then\, promised 9 episodes and unlike real life\, sagas should have endings. But Disney is going to milk this cow until it runs dry. I enjoyed Episode VIII which I saw yesterday. It was great to see Luke and Leia now old and wise\, but what was missing was the creative genius and surprises that George Lucas gave us. The first three episodes were classic\, the next three (the prequel) inventive. Now\, 40 years later the technology and computing power can crate amazing effects. But where is that inventive leap? Where are the surprises? Why has technology not moved on in that galaxy far far away? Why is the story not moving on except for a rehash of old ideas and the lone bomber finding the vulnerable spot in the enemy's ships? Why ...
